title: MCP Uniform vs Keyframe-Aligned Video Quality Comparison

summary.purpose: Demonstrate quality differences between timing calculation approaches
summary.hypothesis: MCP uniform timing will cause quality issues vs keyframe-aligned approach

keyframe_aligned.description: Manual keyframe detection with precise timing

mcp_uniform.description: Uniform time division ignoring video structure
mcp_uniform.expected_quality: Degraded - potential frame loss and artifacts

critical_timing_differences: Similar large differences for all non-first segments

komposteur_production_requirements: Must use keyframe-aligned extraction as baseline
Implement quality gates and frame loss detection
Provide MCP convenience layer on top of proven approach
validation_success: Confirmed keyframe alignment is critical for quality
Identified specific improvements needed for production

next_steps_for_komposteur: Integrate keyframe detection into Komposteur core
Implement frame loss prevention as standard
